item.title: 10 points pour comprendre les containers
item.description:
Description

Qu'est-ce qu'un container? Une image? Peut-on rouler plusieurs programmes dans un seul container? Peut-on utiliser Docker directement ou faut-il un orchestrateur comme Kubernetes? Avec dix questions en dix minutes, vous aurez une bonne compréhension des définitions et des rôles de ces objets, et pourrez mieux apprécier les présentations plus avancées sur le sujet.

Montréal-Python 67: Ultramodern Vintage - PyCon Canada Special https://montrealpython.org/2017/10/mp67/
item.dc:creator: Éric Araujo

item.title: Person of the Month: Donald Stufft
item.description:
Description

Montréal, le 10 mars 2014 - Éric Araujo, organisateur de Montréal Python et Core dev Python, dresse lem portrait de Donald Stufft, qui travaille notamment sur Pip, Django, PyPI ainsi que sur les équipes de sécurité et d'infrastructure de Python.

  • Donald Stufft: http://sflx.ca/dstufft
  • Éric: http://sflx.ca/merwok
  • MP44: http://sflx.ca/mp44e
  • Montreal Python: http://montrealpython.org
  • Savoir-faire Linux: http://www.savoirfairelinux.com
item.dc:creator: Éric Araujo

item.title: Person of the Month: Guido van Rossum
item.description:
Description

Montreal, Jan. 21, 2013 - Python developer Éric Araujo portraits Guido van Rossum, a Dutch computer programmer who is best known as the author of the Python programming language.

item.title: PyCon Canada Wrapup
item.description:
Description

Montreal, Nov. 26, 2012 - Éric Araujo presents a 7'20" wrapup of the first PyCon Canada conference that was held in Toronto two weeks before.

item.title: How you can contribute to Python
item.description:
Description

Montreal, Oct. 22, 2012 - Éric Araujo explains how individual developers can contribute to Python: documentation, patches, etc.

Useful links:

  • Help: http://www.python.org/about/help/
  • MP32: http://montrealpython.org/2012/10/mp32/
  • Montreal Python: http://montrealpython.org

item.dc:creator: Éric Araujo

item.title: How you can contribute to Python
item.description:
Summary

Did you know that you could contribute to Python? From documentation

work to patch reviews to new features to blogging, there are a number of

ways you can give back to Python. This talk for beginners will walk you

through these ways with concrete demonstrations.
item.dc:creator: Éric Araujo

item.title: The Joys and Pains of Using Pyramid
item.description:
Summary

A tour of Pyramid’s best and worst features, from the perspective of developers who love elegance and pragmatism.
item.dc:creator: Éric Araujo

item.title: Why Pyramid is awesome: the example of Facebook applications
item.description:
Summary

Beside the friends, walls and photos, Facebook is a platform where anybody can build applications or games taking advantage of the huge user base and connections between people. Any web-capable language or framework can be used to do that, but this poster will show you why Pyramid is a most excellent choice.
item.dc:creator: Éric Araujo

item.title: Panel: Directions for Packaging
item.description:
Summary

What needs to happen to finally offer a first-class packaging experience to Python users? Several of the people working directly on that problem will be here to answer your questions.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Holth
